net.xuset.objectIO.connections

Interface Connection

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    InetCon, StreamConI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractConnection, FileCon, GroupClientCon, GroupServerCon, StreamCon, StreamConReader, TcpCon, TcpHandshakeCon

    public interface Connection
    Interface that outlines operations for sending and receiving messages across various mediums. A MarkupMsg object is used for sending and reading received messages.

    Implementations are able to choose how the MarkupMsg is sent and received. The message could be sent across a TCP stream, file stream, or some other medium.

    Most implementations will be setup so that sending a message from one Connection will be received by another Connection. Sending can be done by calling sendMsg(MarkupMsg) and getting a received message can be done by calling pollNextMsg()

    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    MarkupMsg, TcpCon, FileCon

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static long BROADCAST_CONNECTION
      This is primarily used as the connectionId when calling Hub.sendMsg(MarkupMsg, long).

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long getId()
      Each connection has a unique id that allows others to distinguish between connections
      boolean isMsgAvailable()
      Returns whether message has been received and can be returned by calling pollNextMsg()
      MarkupMsg pollNextMsg()

      boolean sendMsg(MarkupMsg msg)

    • Field Detail

      • BROADCAST_CONNECTION

        static final long BROADCAST_CONNECTION
        This is primarily used as the connectionId when calling Hub.sendMsg(MarkupMsg, long). If the hub supports broadcasting messages then usually the supplied message is passed to Hub.broadcastMsg(MarkupMsg)
        See Also:
        Hub, Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • sendMsg

        boolean sendMsg(MarkupMsg msg)
        Sends a MarkupMsg. Depending on the implementing class, the message could be set across a TCP stream, file stream, or some other medium.

        Implementations are free to determine how to send messages. The protocol for sending messages is also defined by the implementation.

        Parameters:
        msg - message to send across the connection
        Returns:
        true if the sending the message was successful, false otherwise. It does not guarantee that the message was received.

      • getId

        long getId()
        Each connection has a unique id that allows others to distinguish between connections
        Returns:
        the unique id associated with this connection

      • pollNextMsg

        MarkupMsg pollNextMsg()
        Removes and returns a received message. Messages are returned in FIFO order. So messages received earlier will be returned before messages received latter. Be aware that received messages are not guaranteed to be in the order they were sent.

        this method should only return null if isMsgAvailable() returns false

        In most situations, one Connection will send a message to another Connection. The received message can be read by calling pollNextMsg().

        Returns:
        the next available MarkupMsg or null if there are no messages to poll

      • isMsgAvailable

        boolean isMsgAvailable()
        Returns whether message has been received and can be returned by calling pollNextMsg()
        Returns:
        true if pollNextMsg() will not return null
